result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanner J. Lipke

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tanner J. Lipke in court with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson. Attorney Thorson states there is no offer at this time and requests a few minutes to discuss waiving the preliminary hearing with the defendant. 

10:21 AM: off record.

10:27 AM: case recalled with same appearances. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 

Matter is referred to Judge Barna (Rusk County) for further scheduling.

9:34 AM case called. Defendant Tanner J. Lipke in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Tanner J. Lipke.  Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense was newly appointed.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Robert Thorson at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 08/19/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.
CK 44101 mailed to defendant; signature bond ordered, bail posted refunded.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

No contact with co-defendant Daniel Brewer or his residence. 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

11:22am Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tanner J. Lipke in court without counsel. Waives reading of the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/01/22 at 2:30pm
Hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
